channel.title: Combat Intricacies/Mechanics
channel.description:
So I'm writing combat for the official server, and it's a pretty big task obviously.
I have a few questions about some of the mechanics of combat back in ~2009 era. They probably were the same before that and after that (until EOC of course), but I want to make sure I do everything I can to make it as realistic as possible. I will be updating this post as I have more questions or they are answered.
[ul][li]Combat Delay [list type=decimal] [li]Every weapon for range/melee has its own combat delay, and magic has a flat combat delay of 3 seconds, correct?[/li] [li]If I attack with say, a god sword, and that combat delay is X seconds, and I switch to a bow/staff, I cant cast a damage spell until that combat delay is up, correct? If yes, does that spell queue up and override my next melee attack? In other words is it [[i]weaponattack -> weapondelay (clicking the spell during the delay) -> spell cast (after full weapon delay) -> spell delay (3s) -> weapon attack[/i]] or [[i]weaponattack -> spell cast (instantly when clicking it) -> weapondelay -> weapon attack[/i]][/li] [li]If I cast a spell [/li] [/list] [/li][/ul]
Also if you have any other interesting mechanics that I should include, feel free to post those as well.

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yeah I don’t understand you, that’s what I’ve been saying lol. And your explanation just makes it more confusing. Can you put actual attacks in there like I did? What the fudge does “You swap to DDS with 5 ticks left, reset back to 2 ticks left BUT you now have DDS equipped” even mean?

It sounds like you’re saying

GS Equipped
Attack -> 7 tick timer
Swap to DDS with 5 ticks left -> 2 tick timer now
Two ticks later -> dds attacks

which is what I meant in [quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:543110”]So if you swap to dds in 1 or 2 ticks after swinging with AGS you are effectively lowering the delay of the GS? That sounds like something I wouldn’t want to replicate even if its more rs-like[/quote]
Like, you’re lowering the delay of the GS because normally after you make a GS swing you have to wait 7 ticks to swing again, but if you swap before you’re down to 2 ticks (so between 1-4 ticks in this case), you are able to swing before that with the dds, essentially lowing your overall downtime between attacks. If thats what you mean, then yes, I understood in that other reply I should have just clarified I meant with the dds.

item.title: Combat Intricacies/Mechanics
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:543110”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=661986.msg4424717#msg4424717 date=1400297291]
Every time you swap a weapon your timer is reset.
[/quote]What do you mean? That makes it sound like you could attack swap attack swap attack swap with no delay?[/quote]

The action object is actually calculated from the point and saved in memory from what weapon you equip or have equipped

A player can only do one action at a time, so say if you bury bones during combat UNLESS you have auto retaliate on your action will be reset meaning the data about your combat action is lost. When your auto retaliate is on, if you’re not attacking and are attacked then the action is calculated manually.

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:543110”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=661986.msg4424717#msg4424717 date=1400297291]
Every time you swap a weapon your timer is reset.
[/quote]What do you mean? That makes it sound like you could attack swap attack swap attack swap with no delay?[/quote]
Just the opposite.
Every time you swap it’s reset.
Say I’m wielding a 2h godsword, and it has a 5 second delay.
4.5 seconds into it, I switch to a DDS with a 2 second delay.
It resets, so now I have to wait the additional 2 seconds from the point where I switched. So in total I waited 6.5 seconds.
Assuming I’m interpreting what sini said correctly.

item.title: Combat Intricacies/Mechanics
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I can’t guarantee that these are correct, but I am almost positive they are.

  1. Range/melee does have its own combat delay. I’m pretty sure that it’s a 2 second delay on magic, though.

  2. I believe you will cast it after X seconds as you said, and it does queue it. However, if you were to bring out a new weapon and attack that would override that queue and become the next attack and the magic spell would cancel.

Example:
Player1 uses godsword spec
Player1 attempts to cast fire strike during delay
Player1 attempts to click player to attack with melee Player2 during delay
Player1 attacks Player2 after delay with melee
Player1 continues melee attack until otherwise told
